application

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object

    The Controller Tab

    As part of the MVC style this is the controller class that contains all the functionality of the program.

    • Method Detail

      • Addbutton

        public java.lang.Object Addbutton(java.lang.String w,
                                  java.lang.String d,
                                  java.lang.String combovalue,
                                  java.lang.String p,
                                  javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<java.lang.String> comboB,
                                  javafx.scene.control.TextArea textbox,
                                  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> pointslist,
                                  java.util.ArrayList<application.Activity> arrlist,
                                  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> dateList)
        The Addbutton adds every entry entered in the textfields into an arraylist.
        Parameters:
        w - This holds week value in string form
        d - This holds the date value in string form
        combovalue - This holds the activity value in string form
        p - This holds the points value in string form
        comboB - This holds the combobox list of items
        textbox - This holds the textbox so we can print the resulting arraylist onto it
        pointslist - This is the list of points
        arrlist - This is the list of activities
        dateList - This is the list of dates
        Returns:
        arrlist This returns the list of activities

      • Listbutton

        public void Listbutton(java.lang.String w,
                       java.lang.String d,
                       java.lang.String a,
                       java.lang.String p,
                       java.util.ArrayList<application.Activity> arrlist,
                       javafx.scene.control.TextArea textbox,
                       javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<java.lang.String> combobox)

        The Listbutton displays each activity object in the activity arraylist

        .
        Parameters:
        w - This holds week value in string form
        d - This holds the date value in string form
        a - This holds the activity value in string form
        p - This holds the points value in string form
        arrlist - This is the list of activities
        textbox - This holds the textbox so we can print the resulting arraylist onto it
        combobox - This holds the list of items for the combo box

      • submit

        public java.lang.Object submit(javafx.scene.control.TextArea textbox,
                               java.util.ArrayList<application.Activity> arrlist,
                               javafx.scene.control.TextField indexfield,
                               java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> pointslist,
                               javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<java.lang.String> comboB)

        The submit button is used when we want to remove an object from the Activities arraylist

        .
        Parameters:
        textbox - This holds the textbox so we can print the resulting Activities arraylist onto it
        arrlist - This is the list of activities
        indexfield - This holds the position in which you chose which object to remove from the Activities list
        pointslist - This holds the list of points
        comboB - This holds the list of items for the combo box
        Returns:
        arrlist Returns resulting Activities list after removal of an object.

      • serialise

        public void serialise(java.util.ArrayList<application.Activity> arrlist,
                      javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<java.lang.String> comboB)

        The serialise button serialises the objects into a text file

        .
        Parameters:
        arrlist - This is the list of activities
        comboB - the combo B

      • deserialise

        public void deserialise(java.util.ArrayList<application.Activity> arrlist,
                        javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<java.lang.String> comboB)
                 throws java.io.IOException

        The desserialise button deserialises the char bytes from the text file into text form again.

        Parameters:
        arrlist - This is the list of activities
        comboB - the combo B
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.

      • OrderingByDate

        public void OrderingByDate(javafx.scene.control.TextArea tarea,
                           java.util.ArrayList<application.Activity> a,
                           java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> dateList)

        The OrderingByDate button displays the dates in ascending order. The later years are displayed first. The earlier years are displayed later on in the list.

        Parameters:
        tarea - This holds the text area so we can print the ordered dates onto it
        a - This is the list of activities
        dateList - This holds the list of dates

      • OrderingByActivity

        public void OrderingByActivity(javafx.scene.control.TextArea tarea,
                               java.util.ArrayList<application.Activity> a)

        The OrderingByActivities button displays the activities in alphabetical order

        .
        Parameters:
        tarea - This holds the text area so we can print the ordered dates onto it
        a - This is the list of activities
